result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:19 AM Defendant William M Joseph in court.  Attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe in court for William M Joseph.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases are called to review competency report filed. 
Attorney Babe is not challenging the doctor's report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
State is not challenging the doctor's report.
Report finds Defendant competent to proceed. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
filed by Dr. Matthew Seipel.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 8/05/22
Review hearing on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:19 AM Defendant William M Joseph in court with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called for status.
Defense requests a competency evaluation under 971.14. Court orders a Competency Evaluation under 971.14. Defense requests that the evaluation include IQ and memory testing. 
Court orders an outpatient competency exam, to be conducted by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Evaluation to be filed by 9/09/22. 
Defense requests that trial be adjourned to allow time for evaluation.
Jury Status and Trial dates are cancelled.  Review hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Other cases to tagalong.

Hearing on April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:18 AM Defendant William M Joseph appeared by Zoom with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe who appeared by Zoom.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Prelim waived.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

10:02 AM Defendant William M Joseph in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing March 1, 2021.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
The Court will adjourn the matter.
THE COURT APPROVES APPEARANCES BY ZOOM.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.
